intro: Nolana willeana, commonly known as the Chilean starflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Chile. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its star-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and has a low, sprawling growth habit. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Nolana willeana is adapted to withstand drought and extreme temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
